summary: This adds two batch commands, for viewing and resetting hold bounties.
descriptionHtml:
This mod adds two batch commands, for viewing and resetting hold bounties.

Using the command:  bat freedom
the script will attempt to set your bounty to zero for all the holds (As well as the Orc Tribes)
Beware there are some situations where you will have a crime modifier applied, which a value of zero will still show as having a bounty.

Also provided is the command:  bat freedomcheck
This will display the current bounty for each hold.

Use the page up and page down keys to scroll through the list.


Some notes on usage during a fight.
This can be a bad idea, as it doesn\'t always work as expected.
If a guard is in pursuit, you can set your bounty to 0 and he will still chase you.
Once caught, you will be charged with resisting arrest, and get +40 bounty.
You will still get the normal \'arrested\' dialog.

This command is best used while out of sight and hidden.  
Afterwards the next guards that see you will not give chase.

Another command of interest is:
player.payfinethief

Once used, guards will still give chase, however when caught they will
initiate dialog like normal.  You will lose HALF of your bounty in gold,
but you will retain all of your stolen goods.
This is normally activated in dialog once you have the thieves guild perk.
While I did not have any problems with using it before having that perk,
others have reported game crashes.
If that is the case, up until you gain the perk from the thieves guild,
you can instead try the command:
player.payfine

You will pay your full bounty in gold, and your stolen goods will be placed
in the closest evidence chest.  You will NOT be teleported to the jail however!
author: Dissy
